main event: Observation of a very bright object in the southern sky of Cape May, New Jersey, on December 3, 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed for 40 minutes, moving slightly to the southwest over that time., Witnesses noted characteristics of a bright orange light falling or disappearing over the horizon., There appeared to be an explosion before the object disappeared., The sighting involved multiple types of observation including ground and air visual., Naval Air Station personnel reported the sighting.
